author: _bluelite
content: Hi , what's the reason for this? I was just testing an ETH transfer on dencun-devnet-9 and got this error: "message":"address already reserved"

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: This means your address has some blob transactions pending. Geth will only allow one type of transaction per account in the txpool. So if you send a blob transaction, you need to wait until its mined in order to send another transaction

author: _bluelite
content: Thank you very much. Based on your prompt, I modified the gas parameter of pending blob tx and then resend it . It has now been successful.

author: __flcl
content:
https://github.com/NethermindEth/nethermind/tree/master/tools/SendBlobs 
Send blobs tool is now available with improved feature set:
- you can distribute eth between accounts(can be generated) and collect it back
- you can send loads of normal and broken transactions from those multiple accounts

Check `docker run nethermindeth/send-blobs` for general help
or `docker run nethermindeth/send-blobs distribute --help` for command help

author: _bluelite
content: Hi,  I plan to send blob tx to a contract account, and save the versioned_hash in the contract, And in the next transaction, I will send the data and commitment again to verify the point evaluation precompile. Where can I find contracts with these features?

author: mariusvanderwijden
mariusvanderwijden
content: This is the contract I created for testing, you should be able to adapt it to your use case

author: _bluelite
content: Very useful, Is there a link to the code repository?  How did you save versionedHash to the contract when sending blob tx?  I found this https://github.com/ethstorage/eip4844-blob-hash-getter/blob/main/contracts/BlobHashGetter.sol

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: I am only testing the functionality of the precompile, not the workflow that users would need

author: _bluelite
content: OK, I need to test the DATAHASH (0x49) opcode first.
